questions.question: The cumulative distribution function of a random variable x is the probability that X takes the value?

answers.a: less than or equal to x

questions.question: Consider two identically distributed zero-mean random variable U and V. Let the cumulative distribution function of U and 2V be F(x) and G(x) respectively. Then, for all values of x.?

explanations.a: F(x) is CDF of U than  F(x)= p(U≤ x) G(x) is CDF of 2V than G(x)= p(2V≤ x) G(x)=p(V≤ x/2) given U and V are identical therefore F(x)=p(V≤ x) and G(x)=p(V≤ x/2) F(x) - G(x)= p(V≤ x) - p(V≤ x/2) go by option  let x=2 than F(2)-G(2)= p(V≤ 2) - p(V≤1) p(V≤ x) $ightarrow$ probability from -infinity  to x therefore  p(V≤ 2) - p(V≤1)≥ 0 ⇒F(x)-G(x)≥ 0
